required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inter Scorers Agreement for OSA Screening Scores.
clinical_study.official_title: Inter Scorers Agreement for OSA Screening Scores.

brief_summary.textblock: Four scores are usually performed to detect OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea) patients. These four scores are: STOP-Bang, P-SAP, OSA50 and DES-OSA. These scores have been previously validated. However, a comparison between scorers in the realization of these scores has never been performed.

detailed_description.textblock: Four scores are usually performed to detect OSA (Obstructive Sleep Apnea) patients. These four scores are: STOP-Bang, P-SAP, OSA50 and DES-OSA. These scores have been previously validated. However, a comparison between scorers in the realization of these scores has never been performed. The aim of this study was to evaluate this agreement using statistical methods.

primary_outcome.description: Should the inter-scorers agreement between OSA scoring be accurate?

arm_group.description: All patients include in this study for whom the four OSA scoring will be evaluated

intervention.description: OSA scoring (four scores: STOP-Bang, P-SAP, OSA50, DES-OSA were performed by several scorers on each patients, after what agreement between scores will be evaluated).

study_pop.textblock:
For all the patients include in the study, the four scores (STOP-Bang, P-SAP, OSA50, and DES-OSA) will be performed several times by various scorers.
The agreement between scorers will be statistically evaluated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All preoperative patients in the Cabinet Medical ASTES
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient's refusal

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Eric DEFLANDRE, MD, PhD, FCCP, FAHA
